summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-sixth Avenue, from the South line of Tract "J" of the S. B. Yesler Donation Claim Tracts to the South line of J. H. Rengstorff's Addition; Twenty-fifth Avenue, from East Cherry Street to the South line of J. H. Rengstorff's Addition; East Columbia Street, from Twenty-fifth Avenue to the West line of Stander Addition; East Marion Street, from Twenty-fifth Avenue to the West line of Stander Addition, all in the City of Seattle, by grading the same and constructing concrete sidewalks, together with wooden curbs, gutters, and necessary drains and catch basins, in accordance with Majority Petition, being File No. 30307 in the office of the City Comptroller of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Immediate Payment", under the provisions of Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
